questions.text: Which of the following components is NOT included in the calculation of the HDI?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Literacy rate
Explanation: HDI uses mean years of schooling, expected years of schooling, life expectancy, and GNI per capita, not literacy rate.

questions.text: Which of the following indicators is NOT part of the GHI calculation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Poverty
Explanation: GHI includes undernourishment, child wasting, child stunting, and child mortality, not poverty.

choices.text: The economic impact of health interventions
The influence of a single factor on an outcome
The combination of multiple factors that contribute to an outcome

questions.text: What does a causal pie model illustrate in causal inference?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The combination of multiple factors that contribute to an outcome
Explanation: Causal pie illustrates how multiple component causes together result in disease.

choices.text: Biological, Environmental, Infectious, Nutritional, Genetic, Sociocultural
Behavioral, Economic, Infectious, Nutritional, Genetic, Sociocultural
Biological, Environmental, Industrial, Nutritional, Genetic, Social
Behavioral, Environmental, Industrial, Nutritional, Genetic, Societal

questions.text: What does the acronym "BEINGS" stand for in the BEINGS model?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Biological, Environmental, Infectious, Nutritional, Genetic, Sociocultural
Explanation: BEINGS model lists broad categories influencing health/disease.

questions.text: A DALY of 1 is equivalent to how many years of healthy life lost?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1 year
Explanation: 1 DALY = 1 lost year of "healthy" life.

questions.text: In the context of DALY, what does YLL represent?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Years of Life Lost
Explanation: YLL quantifies premature death compared to a standard life expectancy.

choices.text: QALY is calculated by multiplying the number of years of life gained by the quality of life.
QALY measures only the number of years lived without disability
QALY is always greater than the total years lived in any health state.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding the calculation of QALY?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

QALY is calculated by multiplying the number of years of life gained by the quality of life.
Explanation: QALY = quality of life × duration of time in that health state.

questions.text: Which level of prevention focuses on reducing the severity of disability of an illness or injury after it has occurred?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Tertiary Prevention
Explanation: Tertiary prevention aims to reduce complications and disability.

questions.text: A 42-year-old migrant worker with previous TB treatment has resistance to isoniazid and rifampicin. This is a case of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

MDR
Explanation: MDR-TB is defined by resistance to at least isoniazid and rifampicin.

questions.text: True about leprosy chemoprophylaxis in adults?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Single dose Rifampicin 600 mg
Explanation: WHO recommends a single 600 mg dose of rifampicin for leprosy chemoprophylaxis.

choices.text: Conduct chest X-ray every alternate day
Isolate the patient and start supportive treatment

questions.text: Which of the following is the recommended management approach for a suspected case of measles?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Isolate the patient and start supportive treatment
Explanation: Measles management is mainly supportive and includes isolation to prevent spread.

questions.text: A mother had fever with rash in first trimester; the infant has PDA and hearing loss. Which public health initiative could prevent this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

RA 27/3 strain vaccine during adolescence
Explanation: Rubella (RA 27/3) vaccination before pregnancy prevents congenital rubella syndrome.

questions.text: Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis must be initiated in PLHIV with:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

CD4 count <350 cells/mm³
Explanation: Cotrimoxazole prophylaxis is started when CD4 is <350 cells/mm³ in PLHIV.

questions.text: Which infections need not to be screened before blood transfusion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hep A
Explanation: Hepatitis A is not routinely screened as it is not blood-borne.

questions.text: Co-trimoxazole should be initiated in HIV-exposed infants/children who are HIV-negative:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

From 6 weeks of age
Explanation: Prophylaxis is started from 6 weeks until HIV infection is ruled out.

questions.text: Most cases of polio are seen due to which type of wild polio virus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Type 1
Explanation: Wild poliovirus type 1 is the most commonly circulating and virulent type.

questions.text: ASHA worker is an example of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Community participation
Explanation: ASHA represents community-based health care involvement.

choices.text: Must be resident of the village
Must immunise children less than one year in her area

questions.text: Not true about ASHA:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Must immunise children less than one year in her area
Explanation: ASHA facilitates immunization but does not directly immunize.

questions.text: Which of the following is not posted at SubCentre?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Medical officer
Explanation: Sub-Centres are staffed by MPHWs; MOs are posted at PHCs.

questions.text: This baby came to our Immunization clinic. Can you tell the name of the vaccine given here?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

BCG
Explanation: vaccine given here is BCG as route shown is intradermal.

choices.text: IPV where ANM forgot to mention date and time of opening

questions.text: Which of the following vaccine can be reused once the vaccine is opened?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

JE which is given IM
Explanation: BCG can be reused within 4 hours if not expired and under proper storage, OPV with stage 4 is not reused, IPV can be used but here ANM forgot to mention date and time

choices.text: Minimum incubation period of measles is seven days
Maximum incubation period of measles is 10 days
Period of communicability of measles is approx six days after rash
Period of quarantine is six days

questions.text: Incubation period of measles is 7 to 10 days. Which of the following is not correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Period of quarantine is six days
Explanation: Measles quarantine is 10 days (Max IP)

questions.text: Sexually transmitted disease is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Direct contact
Explanation: STDs are transmitted via direct sexual contact.

questions.text: When infection is transmitted to one stage of life to another stage of life in the vector, this is known as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Transtadial
Explanation: Transtadial transmission is infection passing through life stages of vector.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccine is placed on the topmost level in ice refrigerator?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hepatitis A

Explanation: Diluents are stored at the top of the ILR, above the vaccines, BUT THE VACCINE which is placed at top level is Hepatitis A

questions.text: A group of 90 students went on camping. 90% of them are already vaccinated. On day 1 of camp, 1 student developed measles. After few days, 3 more students developed measles. Find secondary attack rate.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

35%
Explanation: 3 secondary cases among 9 susceptible (10% of 90 = 9; excluding primary case = 8), SAR = (3/8)× 100 = 35%.

questions.text: In a group of 4 people, Rohan developed cough and fever after 5 days, Rahul and Joy developed same symptoms. Joy tested COVID-positive. Which of the following is true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Joy is index case
Explanation: Index case is the first case reported to health authorities, not necessarily the primary case. Here Rohan is Primary case, Rahul and Joy are secondary cases and Joy is Index case

questions.text: Duration between primary case and secondary case is known as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Serial interval
Explanation: Serial interval is the time between onset in primary and secondary cases.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines can be kept in deep freezer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

OPV
Explanation: OPV can tolerate freezing; others are damaged by it.

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy presents with fever, cough, conjunctivitis, and rash starting on face. Missed vaccination. Likely vaccine strain?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Edmonston Zagreb
Explanation: Edmonston-Zagreb is the measles vaccine strain used.

questions.text: ICEBERG phenomenon is seen in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Rubella
Explanation: Rubella has many subclinical cases — classic example of iceberg phenomenon.

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines is light-sensitive?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

BCG
Explanation: BCG is highly light-sensitive and must be protected from light.

questions.text: A pregnant woman is concerned about vaccine-preventable diseases. Recommend which vaccine?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Influenza
Explanation: Influenza vaccine is safe and recommended in pregnancy.

questions.text: Route of MR vaccine is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Subcutaneous
Explanation: MR vaccine is administered subcutaneously.

questions.text: Which OPV is used nowadays in India?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

P1P3
Explanation: Type 2 withdrawn from OPV due to eradication; bOPV has P1 and P3.

questions.text: A 13-month-old unvaccinated baby visits clinic. Which vaccines are recommended?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

OPV
Explanation: OPV can be given catch-up till 5 years; BCG, IPV, Rota not given after 1 year.

questions.text: An 18-month-old missed further pentavalent doses after 6 weeks. What to do?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Complete pending doses
Explanation: Catch-up vaccination should be completed with a gap of 4 weeks.

questions.text: `Which is NOT effective for brucellosis prevention?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Vector control
Explanation: Brucellosis is not vector-borne, so vector control is ineffective.

questions.text: A 32-year-old farmer presents with high-grade fever for 7 days, headache, and a black necrotic lesion on his abdomen. On examination, he has mild hepatosplenomegaly and lymphadenopathy. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Scrub typhus
Explanation: Presence of an eschar (black necrotic lesion) with fever and rural exposure is classic for scrub typhus, caused by Orientia tsutsugamushi.

questions.text: Vector for epidemic typhus:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Louse
Explanation: Epidemic typhus is transmitted by body louse.

questions.text: Pregnant woman with dog bite, no prior rabies vaccination. Management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Vaccine 0,3,7,28 + Ig
Explanation: WHO-recommended PEP schedule with Ig for Category III exposure.

questions.text: Rabies Ig dose:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Human Ig 20 IU/kg on wound
Explanation: Dose is 20 IU/kg infiltrated into wound as much as possible.

questions.text: Sputum culture resistant to isoniazid and rifampicin. Diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

MDR
Explanation: Resistance to both INH and rifampicin = MDR TB.

questions.text: Isoniazid dose in pediatric FDC for DS-TB?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

50 mg
Explanation: Pediatric FDC tablet for TB contains 50 mg isoniazid.

questions.text: TB preventive regimen for MDR-TB household contact?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

6Lfx
Explanation: 6 months of levofloxacin is used for MDR TB contacts.

questions.text: Drug NOT in BPalM regimen:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Levoflox
Explanation: BPaLM includes Bedaquiline, Pretomanid, Linezolid, Moxifloxacin.

choices.text: The role of cultural beliefs in healthcare delivery
The impact of environmental and lifestyle factors on disease occurrence
The effectiveness of healthcare systems across countries

questions.text: Migrant studies are particularly useful in understanding:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The impact of environmental and lifestyle factors on disease occurrence
Explanation:
Migrant studies help differentiate between genetic and environmental causes of disease. When disease patterns change in migrants over generations, it points to lifestyle, environmental exposures, and habits as key factors in disease causation.

questions.text: HIV positive gives birth to a baby girl. At what age of newborn do we do confirmatory test?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

18 months
Explanation: Antibody-based testing is confirmatory after 18 months.

questions.text: A man presents with 2 skin lesions that are lighter than his normal skin color, and he reports a loss of sensation. O/E one thickened nerve. Slit smear negative. Treatment is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

2 drugs for 6 months
Explanation: Paucibacillary case; WHO recommends 2-drug regimen for 6 months.

questions.text: A woman in rural area has few light-colored patches with disability. ASHA suspects leprosy. Incentive ASHA gets:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

₹200
Explanation: As per NLEP guidelines.

questions.text: If API < 1 in Haryana and all districts, it is classified as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Category 1
Explanation: Category 1 = API <1 in entire state & all districts.

questions.text: Fixed needle syringes go into:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

White
Explanation: White = waste sharps (including fixed needle syringes).

questions.text: Blood-stained gloves go into:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Red 
Explanation: Blood-contaminated gloves in red category

questions.text: PMSMA sticker for non-high-risk pregnancies is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Green
Explanation: Green = non-HR; Red = HR pregnancies.

questions.text: Shakir’s tape used for _____; 11.5–12.5 cm = _____
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

MUAC, Moderate malnutrition
Explanation: MUAC 11.5–12.5 cm indicates moderate acute malnutrition.

questions.text: Red triage category indicates:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Critical, needs immediate care
Explanation: Red = most urgent.

questions.text: Changing bedsheets by VIBGYOR code is under:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Abhiyan Indradhanush 
Explanation: Abhiyan Indradhanush promotes hygiene and cleanliness in ESI health facilities.

questions.text: Blue IFA tablet in AMB is for:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

10–19 years
Explanation: AMB program color codes IFA by age are as follows:
Pink: 5-9 years
Blue: 10-19 year
Red: 20-49 year, pregnant, lactating

questions.text: Which stage of the VVM (Vaccine Vial Monitor) indicates that the vaccine must be discarded?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Stage 3 – inner darker than outer
Explanation: Discard vaccine once inner square is darker than the outer circle.

questions.text: Under the ESI Act, for how many weeks can a woman avail paid maternity benefit?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

26 weeks
Explanation: As per recent amendments, maternity leave is 26 weeks under ESI.

questions.text: Transmission Assessment Surveys monitor:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Filariasis
Explanation: Post-MDA evaluation tool.

questions.text: Amplifying host in JE:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pig
Explanation: Pigs = amplifying host; humans = dead-end.

questions.text: Vector of Kala Azar:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Sandfly
Explanation: Leishmania donovani is transmitted by Phlebotomus.

questions.text: What is the cut-off MUAC for diagnosing severe acute malnutrition in children aged 6–60 months?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

< 11.5 cm
Explanation: MUAC <11.5 cm indicates SAM

questions.text: Nalgonda technique removes:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Fluoride
Explanation: Uses alum + lime.

questions.text: Most commonly affected teeth in fluorosis:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Incisors
Explanation: Aesthetic concern in anterior teeth.

questions.text: The given logo is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Fortified 
Explanation: F+ logo = fortified food. These are foods that have added micronutrients like iron, folic acid, vitamin A, and vitamin D to address nutritional deficiencies in the population.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male presents with progressive spastic weakness of the lower limbs. He is a manual laborer from a drought-prone region and reports consuming a locally grown dal as his primary food source for several months. Which of the following neurotoxins is most likely responsible for his condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

BOAA 
Explanation:
BOAA is the neurotoxin present in Lathyrus sativus, responsible for causing neurolathyrism, a condition characterized by upper motor neuron paralysis, especially affecting the lower limbs. Chronic intake in large quantities, especially in poor, drought-affected regions, leads to irreversible spastic paraparesis.

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents with bilateral pitting pedal edema, breathlessness, and Diarrheoa. Multiple members of his family have similar symptoms. He admits to regularly consuming mustard oil from an unlabelled local source. Which of the following food adulteration is most likely responsible for his condition?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Argemone oil
Explanation: Epidemic dropsy is caused by consumption of mustard oil adulterated with Argemone oil, containing the toxin sanguinarine, leading to capillary dilation, edema, and sometimes congestive heart failure.

choices.text: Soiled waste like dressings and bandages

questions.text: A healthcare worker sustains a needle-stick injury while handling an overflowing yellow-colored bag from the hospital ward. According to the Biomedical Waste Management Rules, 2016 (amended), what should ideally be disposed of in yellow bags?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Soiled waste like dressings and bandages
Explanation: Yellow bags are used for soiled waste, such as human tissues, organs, blood-soaked items, and dressings. Needles/sharps should go in white (translucent, puncture-proof containers).

choices.text: MM Ratio uses live births; MM Rate uses women of reproductive age
MM Ratio uses women of reproductive age; MM Rate uses live births
Both use live births as the denominator
Both use women of reproductive age as the denominator

questions.text: What is the correct denominator used in the calculation of Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) and Maternal Mortality Rate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

MM Ratio uses live births; MM Rate uses women of reproductive age
Explanation:
MM Ratio = Maternal deaths per 100,000 live births
Maternal Mortality Rate = Maternal deaths per 100,000 women aged 15–49 years

questions.text: Most common cause of IMR in India:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Prematurity/LBW
Explanation: Leading cause of infant death globally.

questions.text: NNT is the inverse of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Absolute risk reduction
Explanation: NNT = 1 / ARR, showing how many patients must be treated to prevent one event.

questions.text: Most effective approach in Behavior Change Communication (BCC):
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Interpersonal communication
Explanation: Interpersonal communication allows two-way dialogue, making it more impactful.

questions.text: Herd immunity protects:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Susceptible individuals in a population
Explanation: When a large portion is immune, it indirectly protects the non-immune.

questions.text: Which equipment maintains +2°C to +8°C temperature for vaccine transport in case of power failure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Cold box
Explanation: ILRs are used at PHCs to store vaccines at recommended cold chain levels and cold box are used to transport vaccine in case of power cut at PHC

questions.text: DALY is a measure of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Combined mortality and disability
Explanation: DALY combines years of life lost and years lived with disability.

questions.text: Sentinel surveillance is useful for:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Missed cases
Explanation: Sentinel sites provide continuous data to track missed cases of disease over time.

questions.text: VVM is used to monitor:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Heat exposure 
Explanation: VVM indicates heat exposure, affecting vaccine viability.

choices.text: Average number of girls a woman gives birth to
Number of pregnancies per 1000 women per year
Average number of children a woman is expected to have in her lifetime
Number of live births per 1000 population per year

questions.text: A 26-year-old ASHA worker is asked to explain what Total Fertility Rate (TFR) means to villagers. Which of the following best describes TFR in simple terms?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: TFR reflects average births per woman across reproductive age.

choices.text: Each woman is having fewer than 2 children
India is below replacement level fertility
Women are giving birth only to male children

questions.text: During a training session, a health officer says, “India's fertility rate is 2.0 now.” What does this imply?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: TFR of 2.0 is below replacement level (2.1).

questions.text: In a village of 5000 people, 50 infants were born last year. Five of them died before turning one. What is the IMR?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: IMR = (5 / 50) × 1000 = 100

questions.text: A country is experiencing high birth rates and declining death rates due to improved sanitation. Which demographic stage is this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Early expanding stage is marked by high birth and falling death rates.

questions.text: A health analyst notices that dependency ratio is increasing. What does this mean?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: High dependency ratio suggests a growing elderly or child population.

questions.text: In a census, a village has 950 girls per 1000 boys in the 0–6 age group. What does this sex ratio indicate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: Sex ratio below 950 suggests gender bias and male preference.

choices.text: No, twin births are not covered

questions.text: A woman delivers twin girls during her second pregnancy. According to PMMVY 2.0, is she eligible for benefits?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: PMMVY 2.0 gives ₹6000 for second girl child even in multiple births.

questions.text: A country has a narrow-based population pyramid and a wide top. This suggests:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: A narrow base and wide top indicate aging population.

questions.text: In a district, the CBR is 20 and CDR is 6. What is the annual growth rate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Natural growth = (CBR – CDR)/10 = 20 − 6 = 14/10 = 1.4

questions.text: In a region, 80 girls and 70 boys were born. What is the sex ratio at birth?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: (80/70) × 1000 = 1143 ≈ 1140

choices.text: Association between smoking (yes/no) and lung cancer (yes/no)

questions.text: Which of the following scenarios is best analyzed using a chi-square test?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Association between smoking and lung cancer
Explanation: Chi-square is for categorical data.

questions.text: A village has a known population of 1000. In January, 50 new cases of TB were reported, and 150 already had TB. What is the incidence of TB in January?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

58 per 1000

Explanation: Incidence = (new cases / population at risk) × 1000 = (50/850) × 1000 = 58 per 1000

questions.text:
In a tribal area, a health team finds that women are unwilling to discuss reproductive health.
Which type of communication barrier is most likely responsible?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Cultural
Explanation: Cultural beliefs and taboos can hinder communication on sensitive topics.

questions.text: A 1.5-year-old child attends an Anganwadi center for immunization. The health worker also gives him a dose of Vitamin A. What is the appropriate dose and preparation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

2 lakh IU syrup
Explanation: From 9 months onwards, children receive Vitamin A dose. 
< 1year: 2 lakh IU. 
2-5 year: 2 lakh IU.

questions.text: According to the Factories Act, what is the maximum number of hours a worker can work per week in a registered factory?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

48 hours
Explanation: The Factories Act permits a maximum of 48 working hours per week.

questions.text: A 45-year-old male working in a cotton mill for the last 10 years presents with chest tightness and wheezing at the beginning of the work week, which improves by the weekend. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Byssinosis
Explanation: Byssinosis is common in cotton workers and is worse on the first workday of the week.

questions.text: During a factory explosion, a 35-year-old male arrives at the triage area walking on his own. He has minor abrasions on his forearm and is fully conscious, oriented, and has stable vital signs. What triage category does he belong to?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Green tag
Explanation: Green tag is assigned to ambulatory patients with minor injuries who can wait for treatment (also called "walking wounded").

questions.text:
A health program is assessing tobacco use, alcohol consumption, and diet in a community using questionnaires.
Which step of the WHO STEPS approach does this represent?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Step 1
Explanation: Step 1 involves self-reported behavioral data collection.

questions.text:
A resident posted at SEARO headquarters is preparing a report.
Where is the SEARO (South-East Asia Regional Office) of WHO located?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

New Delhi
Explanation: SEARO HQ is in New Delhi, India.

questions.text:
A meta-analysis finds I² = 78%.
What does this suggest?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

High heterogeneity
Explanation: I² >75% indicates substantial variability between studies.

questions.text: Which type of study is best suited to follow PRISMA guidelines?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Systematic review
Explanation: PRISMA is for reporting systematic reviews/meta-analyses.

choices.text: Cultural exchange from interaction between groups

questions.text: In sociology, the term 'acculturation' refers to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: Acculturation involves adopting traits from another culture due to contact.

choices.text: Group of unrelated individuals living together

questions.text: Which of the following defines a 'nuclear family'?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Nuclear family is limited to the couple and their dependent children.

questions.text: Which strategy ensures facility-based delivery and newborn care at public health institutions, with financial incentives to beneficiaries?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: JSY incentivizes institutional deliveries to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality.

questions.text: A 7-day-old neonate with LBW and respiratory distress is admitted to a unit with radiant warmer and oxygen support. Most likely unit?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Newborn Stabilization Unit (NBSU) handles LBW, moderate distress; SNCU for critical neonates.

questions.text: DEICs under RBSK are meant for:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: DEICs provide confirmatory diagnosis, treatment, referral for RBSK-identified children.

questions.text: Nutritional supplementation for pregnant women and lactating mothers is provided under:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: ICDS provides supplementary nutrition through Anganwadi centers

questions.text: Under MAA (Mothers’ Absolute Affection) program, the primary focus is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: MAA aims to increase breastfeeding initiation and exclusive breastfeeding rates.

questions.text: A district hospital invites experts to discuss the rising cases of dengue. A moderator leads the discussion and there is live interaction between experts but no audience Q&A. What technique is being used?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Panel discussion involves experts interacting among themselves, guided by a moderator.

choices.text: In-depth exploration of attitudes and beliefs

questions.text: A team wants to understand why adolescent girls are avoiding iron tablets. They select 8 girls of the same age and socio-economic status and conduct a guided discussion. Which is the primary advantage of this method over a questionnaire?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Focus Group Discussion (FGD) allows qualitative insights into beliefs, motivations, and barriers.

questions.text: A p-value < 0.05 indicates:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: p < 0.05 suggests statistically significant difference; null hypothesis is rejected.

questions.text: A PHC uses ORS, zinc tablets, and clean water to manage diarrheal outbreaks. Which principle is best exemplified?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Use of simple, scientifically sound, low-cost interventions reflects appropriate technology.

questions.text: The maximum duration of sickness benefit under ESI is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Sickness benefit can be availed for up to 91 days in two consecutive benefit periods.

questions.text: A factory worker covered under ESI meets with an accident causing 40% permanent disability. Which benefit is he eligible for?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Permanent partial disablement is compensated under the disablement benefit.

questions.text: Vinyl chloride exposure in a plastic factory is associated with which cancer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Vinyl chloride is classically associated with angiosarcoma of the liver.

choices.text: It promotes passive learning and low retention
It lacks visual clarity and causes distraction
It is unsuitable for small group teaching

questions.text: A medical college professor teaches outbreak investigation using only a blackboard and lecture without student participation. Which statement best describes the method’s limitation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Chalk and talk is passive, lacking student engagement, which can reduce retention.

questions.text: A district plans to reduce maternal mortality. Health officials collect baseline data, identify local barriers, set measurable goals, allocate resources, and define indicators. Which stage of planning cycle is being described here?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: After goal setting, specific plans and strategies are created in the "planning and programming" phase.

questions.text: In a symmetrical distribution:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: In a normal/symmetrical distribution, all three central tendencies coincide.

questions.text: Which of the following is a qualitative data presentation method?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Bar diagrams are used for qualitative/categorical data.

choices.text: Rate showing change in incidence over time

questions.text: In a community, 150 new TB cases were diagnosed in 2024, and 120 cases were diagnosed in 2023. The total population remained at 100,000. Which best describes this comparison?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Rate showing change in incidence over time
Explanation: The difference over time indicates a change in incidence rate.

questions.text: A physician studies cholera outbreaks in different Indian states. The highest incidence is noted in coastal regions during monsoons. This is an example of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Geographic distribution
Explanation: The variation by region shows geographic distribution; monsoons hint at seasonality, but the primary feature described is geographic.

questions.text: A community physician observes a spike in dengue cases every September in Delhi. This pattern represents:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Seasonal trend
Explanation: Dengue showing annual periodicity due to monsoon-related vector breeding is a seasonal trend.

questions.text: In a case-control study on infertility, selecting controls from fertility clinics may lead to which bias?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Berkson’s bias
Explanation: Berkson’s bias arises when hospital-based controls do not represent the general population, especially if hospital admission is related to exposure.

questions.text: A study aims to identify a risk factor for rare neurological tumors. Which is the most appropriate study design?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Case-control study
Explanation: Case-control is ideal for rare diseases and is efficient in terms of time and cost.

questions.text: An investigator compares disease frequency over decades to assess long-term changes in diabetes prevalence in urban India. This is an example of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Secular trend
Explanation: Secular trends refer to disease patterns over years or decades

choices.text: Crude death rate – All deaths in a year
Infant mortality rate – Deaths of infants <1 year
Proportion – Numerator is part of denominator

questions.text: Which of the following is not a correct match between a measure and its numerator?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Attack rate – Total existing cases
Explanation: Attack rate = number of new cases / total at risk. “Existing cases” refers to prevalence, not attack rate.

choices.text: District B has better healthcare access
District A has a higher disease burden
Crude death rate alone is misleading without age-standardization
District B must have lower infant mortality

questions.text: A 45-year-old physician analyzes two districts: District A has a CDR of 12/1000, and District B has a CDR of 8/1000. However, District A has a higher proportion of elderly residents. Which inference is most appropriate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Crude death rate alone is misleading without age-standardization
Explanation: CDR doesn’t account for age structure. District A may have more elderly, inflating CDR despite better health services.

choices.text: Deep freezer is used for vaccines
VVM is used to check heat exposure

questions.text: Which one is incorrect about cold chain?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Deep freezer is used for vaccines 
Explanation: Vaccines must not be stored in deep freezers.

questions.text: Which vaccine is stored in the LOWEST in ILR?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

OPV
Explanation: OPV is heat-sensitive, and stored at lower temperatures.

choices.text: Transport from PHC to outreach sites

questions.text: Vaccine carriers are used to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Transport from PHC to outreach sites
Explanation: Carriers maintain cold chain during vaccine transport to field.

questions.text: Deep freezer can be used to store:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

OPV
Explanation: OPV needs storage at -20°C, hence kept in deep freezer.

questions.text: In ILR, vaccines damaged by freezing are stored:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

In baskets at top
Explanation: To prevent freezing exposure, freeze-sensitive vaccines are stored on top in baskets.

questions.text: Which vaccines should never be frozen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

DPT and Hep B
Explanation: These are damaged by freezing.

questions.text: In a household of 10 susceptible individuals, after exposure to a measles case, 6 others develop the disease. What is the Secondary Attack Rate (SAR)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

66.6%
Explanation: SAR = (6/9) × 100 = 66.6%, excluding the primary case.

questions.text: In a hepatitis A outbreak, the first child who got the infection and spread it to classmates is the:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Primary case
Explanation: Primary case is the person who brings the infection into the population.

questions.text: A patient diagnosed first during a measles outbreak, but not the source, is termed:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Index case
Explanation: Index case is the first case identified and reported.

questions.text: A child with fever and rash is suspected to have measles. What is the best public health measure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Isolation and vitamin A
Explanation: Prevent transmission, and Vitamin A prevents complications.

questions.text: A known diabetic is asked to get annual fundoscopy. This is an example of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Prescriptive screening
Explanation: Targeted monitoring of known cases to prevent complications.

questions.text: A child develops fever, cough, conjunctivitis, and Koplik spots followed by rash starting at face and spreading down. Diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Measles
Explanation: Classic Koplik spots + cephalocaudal rash = Measles

questions.text: A mother asks if chickenpox can be prevented by vaccine. Best response?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Yes, live attenuated vaccine exists
Explanation: Varicella vaccine is live attenuated and preventive.

questions.text: OPV differs from IPV mainly because:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

OPV provides mucosal immunity
Explanation: OPV is live attenuated oral vaccine with gut immunity.

questions.text: Which polio vaccine is used in Pulse Polio campaigns?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

bOPV
Explanation: India uses bivalent OPV (types 1 and 3).

choices.text: Resistance to INH and RIF only
Resistant to INH, RIF, FQ, and second-line injectables

questions.text: Which is true about XDR-TB?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Resistant to INH, RIF, FQ, and second-line injectables
Explanation: XDR-TB is extensively drug-resistant.

questions.text: A TB patient with MDR-TB is started on BPaLM. What does "B" stand for?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Bedaquiline
Explanation: BPaLM: Bedaquiline, Pretomanid, Linezolid, Moxifloxacin.

questions.text: BPaLM is a regimen used for:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

MDR
Explanation: BPaLM is used for drug-resistant TB.

questions.text: Diagnostic test for early HIV detection in newborns:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

HIV DNA PCR
Explanation: Maternal antibodies interfere with ELISA.

choices.text: Time between infection and symptom onset
Time between infection and detectable antibodies
Time between ART and CD4 recovery

questions.text: Window period in HIV refers to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Time between infection and detectable antibodies
Explanation: Antibodies may not be detectable early.

questions.text: A key clinical clue in scrub typhus is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Eschar
Explanation: Painless black scab at bite site.

questions.text: Scrub typhus is caused by
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Orientia tsutsugamushi
Explanation: Common rickettsial disease in Asia-Pacific.

questions.text: Fever is transmitted primarily by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Aerosols from livestock
Explanation: Inhalation of contaminated dust.

questions.text: The drug used for mass drug administration in filariasis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

DEC + Albendazole
Explanation: Single annual dose under MDA strategy.

questions.text: Filaria is transmitted by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Culex
Explanation: Culex quinquefasciatus transmits W. bancrofti

questions.text: Anopheles mosquito shows:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Night-biting with angle-resting posture
Explanation: Characteristic of Anopheles.

questions.text: For plague outbreak control, the priority is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Rat control and flea eradication
Explanation: Breaks transmission cycle.

questions.text: The primary vector of plague is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Rat flea (Xenopsylla cheopis)
Explanation: Transmits Yersinia pestis.

questions.text: Re-exposure prophylaxis for rabies includes:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Tetanus toxoid + rabies vaccine
Explanation: IMMUNOGLOBULINS ARE NOT INDICATED IN RE EXPOSURE

questions.text: The causative organism of leptospirosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Leptospira interrogans
Explanation: Spirochete causing leptospirosis

questions.text: Dengue virus is transmitted by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Aedes aegypti
Explanation: Primary vector for dengue.

questions.text: Which of the following best represents the declining phase of the demographic cycle?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Birth rate < Death rate
Explanation: Leads to population shrinkage.

questions.text: Postpartum IUCD should ideally be inserted within:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

48 hours
Explanation: Known as PPIUCD window

questions.text: Lifespan of CuT 380A is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

10 years
Explanation: Provides long-term contraception.

questions.text: Which of the following does not affect the gross reproduction rate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mortality of girl child
Explanation: GRR assumes no mortality.

questions.text: Which indicator includes births per 1000 married women (15–49 years)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

General marital fertility rate
Explanation: Restricted to married women.

questions.text: Replacement level fertility is achieved when TFR is approximately:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

2.1
Explanation: Slightly above 2 due to female mortality.

questions.text: A sub-centre is directly under supervision of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

PHC
Explanation: SCs are field-level units reporting to PHC.

questions.text: ASHA is not expected to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Administer vaccines
Explanation: Only ANM is trained and authorized for vaccine administration.

questions.text: Which health worker is primarily responsible for immunization at sub-centre?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

ANM
Explanation: ANM delivers vaccines and manages cold chain at SC.

questions.text: A CHC in hilly areas is designed to cover a population of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

80,000
Explanation: CHC norms are 1,20,000 for plains, 80,000 for hilly/tribal areas.

questions.text: Which is the first referral unit (FRU) in the Indian health system?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

CHC
Explanation: CHC serves as FRU for emergency obstetric care and newborn care

choices.text: One ANM and one male health worker

questions.text: Sub-centre is staffed by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

One ANM and one male health worker
Explanation: This is the minimal staffing pattern as per IPHS.

questions.text: Under Anemia Mukt Bharat, children aged 6–59 months receive:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

20 mg iron + 100 mcg folic acid
Explanation: Weekly iron-folic acid supplementation protocol.

questions.text: A person suffers from convulsions and ataxia. He has consumed millets with fungal contamination. Which toxin is responsible?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Ergot alkaloids
Explanation: Convulsions and gangrene due to ergot-contaminated grains.

questions.text: A 7-year-old child with a vegetarian diet has poor wound healing, gum bleeding, and perifollicular hemorrhages. Most likely deficiency?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Vitamin C
Explanation: Scurvy symptoms – bleeding, poor collagen formation.

questions.text: A middle-aged woman with chronic hepatitis B has been consuming stored groundnuts. She presents with rapid liver enlargement and jaundice. Which toxin is likely responsible?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Aflatoxin
Explanation: Potent hepatocarcinogen causing liver damage and cancer.

questions.text: A 4-year-old has diarrhea, dermatitis in sun-exposed areas, and dementia. Diet is predominantly maize-based. Most probable deficiency:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Niacin
Explanation: Pellagra – 3 D’s from niacin or tryptophan deficiency.

questions.text: A filter is cleaned by backwashing and uses coagulants. It lacks a biological layer. Type of filter?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Rapid sand filter
Explanation: Typical features of RSF.

questions.text: A patient is exposed to ultraviolet (UV) radiation. Which disease risk is increased?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Skin cancer
Explanation: UV is carcinogenic to skin.

questions.text: Which government agency regulates biomedical waste management in India?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

CPCB (Central Pollution Control Board)
Explanation: CPCB enforces BMW rules.

choices.text: Yellow for sharps, red for dressings, blue for gloves
Red for sharps, yellow for dressings, white for gloves
White for sharps, yellow for dressings, red for gloves
White for gloves, yellow for dressings, red for sharps

questions.text: A hospital generates sharps, soiled dressings, and used gloves. According to BMW rules, which color-coded bins should be used for disposal?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

White for sharps, yellow for dressings, red for gloves
Explanation: White is for sharps (puncture-proof), yellow for infectious waste, red for recyclable plastics like gloves.

questions.text: Q Fever is caused by:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Coxiella burnetii
Explanation: Obligate intracellular bacterium.

questions.text: A 35-year-old man is detected during a cholera outbreak investigation to be excreting Vibrio cholerae in his stools, despite never having developed any symptoms of diarrhea or vomiting. What is the most appropriate epidemiological classification for this individual?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Asymptomatic carrier
Explanation:
An asymptomatic carrier harbors and sheds the pathogen without ever developing clinical illness. In cholera, such carriers—though rare—can still transmit infection. The term "latent case" is not applicable here as cholera does not have a latent phase.

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy presents with fever, sore throat, and a grayish-white membrane over the tonsils. He is unvaccinated. What is the most appropriate immediate step?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: Diphtheria antitoxin is life-saving; antibiotics alone are insufficient

choices.text: Wait until delivery to start ART
Give nevirapine to the baby after birth

questions.text: A woman tests positive for HIV at 28 weeks of gestation. What is the next best step in preventing transmission to the baby?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Immediate ART in mother reduces vertical transmission.

questions.text: A weaned child on polished rice develops edema and irritability. Deficiency of?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: Polished rice → thiamine deficiency → beriberi.

questions.text: A child is immunized under U-WIN. What is the primary function of U-WIN?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: U-WIN tracks immunization digitally.

choices.text: Yes if VVM stage is acceptable

questions.text: A vial of TT opened 4 days back is kept under cold chain. Can it be used?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation: Open Vial Policy allows use if stored correctly and VVM is valid.

questions.text: Which vaccine is given subcutaneously?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: MR is given subcutaneously.

questions.text: A child is brought with dog bite, Category III. Already received 3 doses of ARV last year. What is the protocol?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: WHO recommends 2 booster doses if previously vaccinated.

questions.text: A clinical trial shows Relative Risk of 1.0. What does it indicate?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: RR = 1 means no association between exposure and outcome.

questions.text: A researcher finds median of hospital stay is 5 days. What does this imply?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: Median = value at 50th percentile.

questions.text: An investigator repeats the same study 3 times and gets similar results. This implies:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Consistency of repeated results = reliability.

questions.text: In TB, number of new smear positive cases detected is a measure of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: New cases = incidence.

questions.text: Human anatomical waste like placenta is disposed in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Yellow bag = human anatomical waste.

questions.text: Plastic IV sets and gloves after use are disposed in:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Explanation: Red = plastic disposable items for recycling.

questions.text: A newborn has congenital heart defect. Which program facilitates free referral and treatment?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: RBSK screens and refers children with congenital defects.

questions.text: An ASHA worker gets ₹600 for accompanying a mother to hospital. Incentive is under:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: JSY incentivizes ASHA for institutional delivery.

questions.text: Contraceptive with longest protection among CuT types:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: CuT 380A effective for 10 years.

questions.text: Infant receives vaccine stored in damaged VVM stage 4. Develops sepsis. This AEFI is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Improper cold chain breach = program error.

questions.text: How soon should a serious AEFI be reported after it occurs?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: Serious AEFIs must be notified within 24 hours.

questions.text: Housing should have a minimum floor space of __ per person, as per standards.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Explanation: WHO recommends ≥100 sq ft/person

questions.text: Which of the following is not a component of the Air Quality Index (AQI)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Explanation: AQI includes 8 pollutants; radon is not part.
